snippet: The United States is restarting its effort to try Khalid Shaikh Mohammed and four others at Guantánamo Bay.
abstract: Brig Gen Mark S Martins, chief prosecutor in the military commissions system, is restarting effort to try Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, mastermind of the September 11 terrorist attacks, and four other detainees at Guantanamo Bay Naval Base; says trial will be fair and that he intends to show the world that the tribunal system is legitimate.
lead_paragraph: The United States is restarting its effort to try Khalid Shaikh Mohammed and four others at Guantánamo Bay.

headline.seo: U.S. to Restart Tribunal, Aiming to Show It’s Fair
headline.main: U.S. to Restart Tribunal, Aiming to Show It’s Fair
headline.print_headline: At Guantánamo, Trial for 9/11 Defendants, and for a Revamped Tribunal
